contentrichtext.text: '''Nagoum Yamassoum''' (born 1954) is a [[Chad]]ian politician from the district of Grande Sido in the region of Moyen Chari. He was [[Prime Minister of Chad]] from 1999 to 2002 and [[foreign minister|Minister of State for Foreign Affairs]] from 2003 to 2005. Yamassoum, who received a doctorate degree in political science from the [[University of Bordeaux]] in [[France]], directed President [[Idriss Déby]]'s campaign for the [[Chadian presidential election, 1996|1996 presidential election]].<ref name=Homme>[http://www.jeuneafrique.com/Articles/Dossier/ARTJAJA2605p074-075.xml1/idriss-deby-itno-secretaire-general-mps-nagoum-yamassoumnagoum-yamassoum-un-homme-de-terrain.html "Nagoum Yamassoum, un homme de terrain"], ''Jeune Afrique'', 27 December 2010 {{fr icon}}.</ref> After serving as President of the [[Constitutional Council of Chad|Constitutional Council]], he was named Prime Minister of Chad on December 13, 1999;<ref>[http://www.int.iol.co.za/index.php?set_id=1&click_id=86&art_id=qw945179220348B232 "Chad president shuffles government"], Reuters (''IOL''), December 14, 1999.</ref> he had also previously served as Minister of Education and Minister of Culture.<ref>[http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/africa/565097.stm "New PM for Chad"], BBC News, December 14, 1999.</ref> He served as Prime Minister until June 12, 2002,<ref>{{Cite book|url=http://books.google.co.uk/books?id=Mz-fXRsedPMC&pg=PA99&dq=%22nagoum+yamassoum%22&hl=en&ei=rFfdTMGpDtKGhQfcm7nTDQ&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct=result&resnum=7&ved=0CEUQ6AEwBg#v=onepage&q=%22nagoum%20yamassoum%22&f=false|title=Profiles of people in power: the world's government leaders |author1=Roger East |author2=Richard Thomas |isbn=978-1-85743-126-1|accessdate=2010-10-12 |publisher=Routledge |year=2003}}</ref> when he resigned and was replaced by [[Haroun Kabadi]].<ref>{{Cite book|title=Africa Review 200 -op/075 |url=http://books.google.co.uk/books?id=nDSR1FF2hY8C&pg=PA60&dq=%22nagoum+yamassoum%22&hl=en&ei=rFfdTMGpDtKGhQfcm7nTDQ&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct=result&resnum=10&ved=0CFUQ6AEwCQ#v=onepage&q=%22nagoum%20yamassoum%22&f=false|publisher=Kogan Page Publishers |year=2003 |isbn=978-0-7494-4065-7 |accessdate=2010-10-12}}</ref> In June 2003, when Kabadi's government resigned and a new government led by [[Moussa Faki]] took office, Yamassoum was appointed as the Minister of State for Foreign Affairs.<ref>{{Cite book|url=http://books.google.co.uk/books?id=jj4J-AXGDaQC&pg=PA234&dq=%22nagoum+yamassoum%22+Foreign&hl=en&ei=sWTdTJ6yNIPOhAedlpnNDQ&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct=result&resnum=3&ved=0CDAQ6AEwAg#v=onepage&q=%22nagoum%20yamassoum%22%20Foreign&f=false |title=Africa South of the Sahara 2004 |author=Europa Publications |publisher=Routledge |year=2003 |isbn=978-1-85743-183-4|accessdate=2010-10-12}}</ref> He left that position in August 2005 when a cabinet reshuffle occurred. Yamassoum was appointed as Chairman of the Board of the [[Hydrocarbons Company of Chad]] (''Societe des Hydrocarbures du Tchad'', SHT) in November 2007.<ref>[http://www.africaintelligence.com/C/modules/login/DetailArt/LoginDetailArt.asp?rub=login&lang=ANG&service=BRE&context=HIS&doc_i_id=35082933 "Board Appointed"], ''Africa Energy Intelligence'' N°452, Africa Intelligence, November 21, 2007.</ref> Later, as Secretary-General of the [[Patriotic Salvation Movement]] (MPS), Yamassoum was entrusted with leading the ruling party into 2011, a major election year—both parliamentary and presidential elections were planned. Critics argued that he lacked popularity with the party base.<ref name=Homme/> He was replaced as Secretary-General by [[Haroun Kabadi]] in January 2011, before the elections were held.<ref>[http://www.afriqueavenir.org/2011/01/17/idriss-deby-itno-investi-candidat-a-la-presidentielle-d%E2%80%99avril/ "Idriss Déby Itno investi candidat à la présidentielle d’avril"], African Press Agency, 17 January 2011 {{fr icon}}.</ref> ==References== {{Reflist}} {{S-start}} {{Succession box| title=[[Prime Minister of Chad]] | before=[[Nassour Guelendouksia Ouaido]] | after=[[Haroun Kabadi]] | years=December 12, 1999 – June 13, 2002}} {{S-end}} {{ChadPMs}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Yamassoum, Nagoum | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Prime Minister of Chad | DATE OF BIRTH = 1954 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Yamassoum, Nagoum}} [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Government ministers of Chad]] [[Category:1954 births]] {{Chad-politician-stub}}
